metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9430 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in the Tatsuya Kinoshita w3m fork before 0.5.3-31. w3m allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (segmentation fault and crash) via a crafted HTML page.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9430` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

w3m - 0.5.3-15ubuntu0.1
w3m-img - 0.5.3-15ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: w3m package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.5.3-15ubuntu0.1').
